summary: This is a transcript of a voluntary sworn interview conducted by DOJ OIG Special Agents with a Federal Bureau of Prisons Correctional Systems Officer (S. ) regarding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 9-10, 2019. The interview focuses on the officer's duties, knowledge of inmate movements, count procedures, and the circumstances surrounding Epstein's cellmate, Efrain Reyes, leaving the MCC and not returning prior to Epstein's death.

events.title: OIG Interview of BOP Officer
events.description: The Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General conducts a voluntary sworn interview with BOP Correctional Systems Officer S. regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein and surrounding circumstances.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Road, New York, NY
R&D (Receiving and Discharge) area at MCC
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate, Efrain Reyes, was removed from the MCC on August 9, 2019, at 8:38 a.m. after going to court and did not return, leaving Epstein without a cellmate.

There were significant count discrepancies in the SHU on the night of August 9-10, 2019, due to an inmate (Fernandez) being moved to a dry cell in R&D but not being properly keyed out of the SHU population.

The interviewed officer states that if staff knew an inmate was leaving "WAB" (With All Belongings) and knew Epstein required a cellmate, they should have taken immediate action to assign a new cellmate, but communication failures and lack of training at the MCC were common.
Camera coverage in the SHU at the time was poor; the Control Center could only see a distant, unclear view of the multi-purpose area, not the individual cell ranges.

The officer expresses her personal belief that Jeffrey Epstein took his own life, citing the environment as a "culture shock" to him, and states she has no knowledge or reason to believe anyone else was involved.
